intro: Pinalia moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan pinalia, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
